EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.    Facility Accidental Release Policy

The owners, management, and employees of the Bear River Supply, Inc., Rio Oso Facility (herein referred to as BRSI or the Facility) at 218 Pleasant Grove Road, Rio Oso, California 95674 are committed to the prevention of an accidental release of aqua ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the Facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  A detailed Emergency Response/Contingency Plan has been developed and will be implemented in the event of an accidental release.

2.    Facility Information

?    The Facility is a retail agricultural facility whose primary activity is the storage and sale of fertilizers, in addition to, the sale of pre-packaged agricultural chemicals to farmers.

?    Aqua ammonia is received by truck, stored in two 10,000 gallon aboveground storage tanks, and distributed for direct application as crop production nutrients.  The maximum quantity of aqua ammonia handled at the site is 154,000 pounds.

3.        The Worst-Case Release Scenario and Alternative Release Scenario

The worst-case release scenario is a release of 77,000 pounds of aqua ammonia, the volume of the largest storage tank when full, in to the secondary containment berm.  The alternative release scenario based on the hazard review (or a more plausible potential incident) is a release from a pipe break within the secondary containment berm, modeled with an increased wind speed and "D" Stability modeling parameters.

4.    Accidental Release Prevention Program

The Facility has implemented the following prevention program elements.

Safety Information:  BRSI ensures that information concerning the covered process and regulated substance is up-to-date and available for review by employees.  The most recent review of safety information pertaining to the covered process took place on January 10, 2014.

The most recent compliance audit was conducted on March 14, 2012.

Incident Investigation:  An incident investigation program is in place at the Facility and incident investigation procedures would be implemented, if needed.

5.    Five-year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of aqua ammonia during the last five years resulting in death, injuries, evacuation, sheltering in place, or property or environmental damage.

6.    The Emergency Response Program

The Facility's emergency response program has been developed in accordance with the following regulations:

?    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38; and

?    Section 25503, Division 6.95 of the California Health and Safety Code, Hazardous Materials Business Plan.

The Emergency Response/Contingency Plan was most recently updated on March 21, 2014 and will be implemented in the event of a release of a regulated substance.

7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going activity at the Facility.  Periodic evaluations will be performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  Specific changes to the aqua ammonia process at the Facility will be implemented as needed.
